biweekly.io

Class TimezoneAssignment

  • java.lang.Object
    • biweekly.io.TimezoneAssignment

  • public class TimezoneAssignment
extends Object
    Represents a timezone definition that is used within an iCalendar object.
    Author:
    Michael Angstadt

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      Creates a timezone that will be inserted into the iCalendar object as a "global ID".
      TimezoneAssignment(TimeZone timezone, VTimezone component)
      Creates a timezone that will be inserted into the iCalendar object as a VTIMEZONE component.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TimezoneAssignment

        public TimezoneAssignment(TimeZone timezone,
                  VTimezone component)
        Creates a timezone that will be inserted into the iCalendar object as a VTIMEZONE component. This what most iCalendar files use.
        Parameters:
        timezone - the Java timezone object
        component - the iCalendar component
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given VTimezone component doesn't have a TimezoneId property

      • TimezoneAssignment

        public TimezoneAssignment(TimeZone timezone,
                  String globalId)

        Creates a timezone that will be inserted into the iCalendar object as a "global ID". This means that a VTimezone component containing the timezone definition will NOT be inserted into the iCalendar object.

        Because the timezone definition is not included inside of the iCalendar object, the client consuming the iCalendar object must know how to interpret such an ID. The iCalendar specification does not specify a list of such IDs, but suggests using the naming convention of an existing timezone specification, such as the public-domain TZ database.

        Parameters:
        timezone - the Java timezone object
        globalId - the global ID (e.g. "America/New_York")

    • Method Detail

      • download

        public static TimezoneAssignment download(TimeZone timezone,
                          boolean outlookCompatible)
        Creates a timezone whose VTIMEZONE component is downloaded from tzurl.org.
        Parameters:
        timezone - the Java timezone object
        outlookCompatible - true to download a VTimezone component that is tailored for Microsoft Outlook email clients, false to download a standards-based one
        Returns:
        the timezone assignment
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if an appropriate VTIMEZONE component cannot be found on the website

      • getTimeZone

        public TimeZone getTimeZone()
        Gets the Java object associated with the timezone.
        Returns:
        the Java object

      • getComponent

        public VTimezone getComponent()
        Gets the iCalendar component associated with the timezone.
        Returns:
        the component or null if the timezone uses a global ID

      • getGlobalId

        public String getGlobalId()
        Gets the global ID associated with the timezone.
        Returns:
        the global ID or null if the timezone uses an iCalendar component
